data.text: @chlowinfield1 I haven’t seen any “ order “ so far . Having said that , I’m happy for whoever has received it already.

@chlowinfield1 during todays press conference BoJo said NHS staff were curently offered vacine to avoid vacine batch going to waste. if it is the case then it would depend of how the vacine stock and locgistics are doing in the town you work in
@chlowinfield1 Covid risk assessments mainly I think, and priority for those in patient facing roles.
@chlowinfield1 Just glad to know people there are now going to be protected.
@chlowinfield1 I spent 48 hrs masked up and trying to isolate from my household which was not an easy hospital to home transition.. had to chase result 3 times.

@chlowinfield1 Patients don't get tested at all beyond the initial feeder isolation ward. I had no test for 3 weeks as an inpatient. I asked for one in my discharge cpa due to vulnerable family member, Told no. They changed their mind an hr before I left.
@chlowinfield1 If anyone brought it onto the ward we'd have all had it, very hard to follow guidance. Essential for staff.

@chlowinfield1 Hope schizophrenic patients can also receive it soon as they often have lack of insight and antipsychotic meds play havoc with their white blood cell count...these patients are extremely vulnerable to Covid infection and complications
@chlowinfield1 i think it may be in order but im not too sure. my mum is a district nurse and hasn't been offered one yet
@chlowinfield1 Very good to hear, it's impossible for psyc staff to distance and they and patients are very vulnerable.
@chlowinfield1 In our trust individual circumstances are triaged to decide on order of vaccines
@chlowinfield1 good that she has received it- staff show a lot of commitment and good that it is acknowledged
